ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
The daops library (pronounced "day-ops") provides a python interface to a
set of operations suitable for working with climate simulation outputs.
It is typically used with ESGF data sets that are described in NetCDF files.
daops is unique in that it accesses a store of fixes defined for data sets
that are irregular when compared with others in their population.

The daops library (pronounced "day-ops") provides a python interface to a
set of operations suitable for working with climate simulation outputs.
It is typically used with ESGF data sets that are described in NetCDF files.
daops is unique in that it accesses a store of fixes defined for data sets
that are irregular when compared with others in their population.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "daops" %}
{% set version = "0.15.0" %}
{% set python_min = "3.10" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/daops-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 40771622ea284ffea7cf7d4dfc8a0988a71c2f07ad06a7a244ff4402943c77df

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - flit-core >=3.9,<4.0
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - clisops >=0.16.1
    - dask >=2.6.0
    - elasticsearch >=8.0.1
    - cftime >=1.4.1
    - netcdf4 >=1.4
    - numba
    - numpy >=1.24.0,<2.0.0
    - roocs-grids >=0.1.2
    - sparse >=0.8.0
    - xarray >=2025.1.1,<2025.3.0
    - xesmf >=0.8.2
    - intake >=0.7.0,<2.0
    - pandas >=2.1
    - loguru >=0.5.3
    - fsspec
    - aiohttp
    - zarr >=2.13.3
    - zstandard


test:
  imports:
    - daops
    - daops.data_utils
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}

about:
  home: https://github.com/roocs/daops
  summary: daops - data-aware operations
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE

  description: |
    The daops library (pronounced "day-ops") provides a python interface to a
    set of operations suitable for working with climate simulation outputs.
    It is typically used with ESGF data sets that are described in NetCDF files.
    daops is unique in that it accesses a store of fixes defined for data sets
    that are irregular when compared with others in their population.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ellesmith88
    - cehbrecht
    - zeitsperre
